adjectives.description: elbowy (comparative more elbowy, superlative most elbowy)

entries.meaning: (of a person’s body) Tall and awkward.
examples: Doubtless it gratifies you to observe
All looking adoration as you swerve

entries.meaning: (of a person’s movement) Awkward; especially, involving the awkward protrusion of the elbows.
examples: […]  I was noticing how very elbowy his gestures were  […]

entries.meaning: (of a tree or branches) Having bends that resemble elbows.
examples: I  […]  looked out over my garden: the unkempt lush grass and the sweet-gum tree with elbowy boughs, crotchety and irregular.

entries.meaning: (of a built structure) Angular in an awkward way.
examples: It is a place fit for a lady of her quality, and none of your elbowy dwellings like these crowded about us. One may easily tell the house, by its pretty blinds and its shades.
